To preface, I'd like to say that I would love to recommend this game and will put a recommendation because stylistically it hits every note it should and the developers are slowly improving the game. 
That out of the way, I cannot in good conscience recommend this game to new players in it's current state. 
The progression system is a nigh-insurmountable barrier to entry preventing what i believe is the core of the game (Playing around with the various perks to create interesting styles of play across multiple characters). 
At the time of writing, there are currently 27 Survivors and 24 Killers, The way the progression system works requires you to spend points you earn in game on a procedurally generated web of nodes in order to unlock perks from one character on another. 
The average point cost to unlock all three of a survivors perks is somewhere in the ballpark of 1.1-1.3 million. 
Especially starting out, when players aren't playing in a way that tries to maximize their point generation, the average point total I see is anywhere from 5000 (unlucky/bad) - 40000 (Absolute gigachad with BP generators). 
This is SOMEWHAT mitigated by typical mechanics such as daily objectives (randomized and made to encourage you to play different things) and the Archives, which is a series of conditional missions that updates every few weeks or so. 

Now many sources will try to tell you "Oh you don't need perks to play the game!" which is partially true, sure, and  would be much more true if there was any kind of match making system in the game. You could be brand new to the game, have nothing unlocked but your base perk slot and no add ons, and your opponent is a Sub-5 ranked Killer/Survivor bullying you with their full build of maxed out add-ons and perks and vast difference in game sense. Its discouraging as hell for anyone who doesn't want to set up a colostomy bag and one of those hamster water bottles to no-life it. 

I want to see this game continue to build and grow on its current foundations and expand the community; however, I'm not sure that they can do that sustainably with their current release schedules and back catalog of characters.

TL;DR

Pros:
-Nails the aesthetic
-Plenty of licensed characters to draw commercial audiences
-Interesting and unique killers

Cons:
-High barrier of entry
-No real matchmaking (They are testing MMR, but it's been a mixed bag)
-Occasional server issues 
-A Battlepass*

Total Rating: 6.5/10, potential to be an 8. 

(* Completely subjective, Dev's gotta eat, but you'd think base game and add-ons would sell enough to support it)

This game can be challenging, toxic, a place to meet nice folk, a reason to lose sanity. 

If you want a game where you can hide and outsmart people. This is the game for you as a survivor!

If you want a game where you feel overpowered and chase people till your need is sated. This is the game for you as a killer!

cons: bugs,cheaters, toxic people, bad teammates might be more common than you think

pros: fun if u got friends or join a discord server who love dbd. The game is fun and challenging if you like that kind of game then this is the game for you.

Super cooles Spiel, für alle Leute die kompetitive und leicht gruselige Spiele mögen zu empfehlen, aber deutlich klarzustellen ist: Es ist kein Horrorspiel im üblichen Sinne und hat auch keine Singleplayer-Elemente.

Ich hab zum Zeitpunkt dieses Reviews ca. 250 Stunden Spielzeit und es wichtig zu erwähnen, dass man in den ersten 10-20 Spielstunden leicht frustriert sein kann, da die Mechaniken des Spiels zwar gut erklärt (Tutorial), aber tatsächlich deutlich schwerer umzusetzen sind.
So wird es einem neuen Spieler als Survivor womöglich nicht direkt gelingen zu überleben - bzw als Killer nicht direkt gelingen jemanden/alle wirklich tot zu bekommen.

Im Großen und Ganzen ein gutes rundenbasiertes Spiel, das definitiv anders ist, als andere Spiele auf dem Markt, durch die Thematik, das Gameplay und die 1v4 Aufstellung - definitiv als Abwechslung zu Empfehlen!

A great co-op experience with friends! A very creepy atmosphere while watching for the killer working on generators. The thrill of being chased by the killer is great and can cause a jump scare from time to time. Playing as the killer is way more tactical in my opinion and you really need to learn your character.

There's a reason why no other game in the asymmetrical PvP genre can suceed quite like this one. This game has made me laugh so hard so many times that I can't NOT recommend it to anyone looking for either a fun, teamwork-based cooperative or a overarching menace of a playstyle that revolves around slaying players one by one until they're all dead.

PROS:
- Extremely fun co-op experience to play with friends
- Difficult but satisfying solo PvP experience if Killer is your cup of tea
- Cool collection of characters to level up that incentivizes the grind
- Easy to learn, difficult to master

CONS:
- Frustrating at certain points, especially against annoying strategies
- Queue times can be long, especially when in parties
- Community within the game can tend to be toxic
- Quite a few bugs that still need to be ironed out

Just started playing the game after watching a friend. Has a bit of a steep learning curve, but it's well worth the time. Survivor can be a bit more frustrating at the start if you are solo, and killer you may need to get some perks to really get some more momentum in the higher ranks, In the end it is the prime example of how good asymmetrical multiplayer cane be and after about 5 or so hours I was hooked.

Great game and really fun, especially if you're playing survivior with friends! At the beginning it may be frightening to get into a game, and that'd be so fun to re-live! You still get the occational jump-scares and you can just laugh that off after you've done being afraid in the moment!

Overall, the game is really fun, playing both as the killer and the surviviors!
I'd say that the killer playstyle is more dedicated to the solo players whilst the surviviors is more focused on group play or co-op between players.
Both are really fun and doing mindgames as both sides against one and another is really fun! It's truely a great game!
